attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
My asthma is controlled by taking two different inhalers.  without them I could die.

I currently spend £172 on two inhalers every year, I cannot afford to pay the upfront payment for the annual prescription charge so I pay for my inhalers when i need them.

The following conditions do not have to pay for their prescription:

* A permanent fistula requiring an appliance or continuous surgical dressing.
* A form of hypoadrenalism for which specific substitution therapy is needed.
* Diabetes insipidus or other forms of hypopituitarism.
* Diabetes mellitus, except where treatment is by diet alone.
* Hypoparathyroidism.
* Myasthenia gravis.
* Myxoedema 
* Epilepsy requiring continuous anticonvulsive therapy.
* Continuing physical disability which means the person can't go out without the help of another person. 

Asthma is not on this list.

Asthma is a killer, it is becoming more common in the uk and I believe patients should be able to get their medication to help them breath without paying for it.  

Smokers get free patches and gum, they choose to smoke, I didn't choose asthma.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
